headlines.description: Jevon Carter sank the go-ahead 3-pointer with 57.5 seconds left and No. 2 West Virginia escaped with a 57-54 victory over Baylor on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: No. 2 West Virginia escapes with 57-54 win over Baylor

video.headline: West Virginia hangs on for 15th straight win

headlines.description: Kyle Guy scored 22 points, De'Andre Hunter added 15 and No. 3 Virginia beat Syracuse 68-61 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Guy's 22 points push No. 3 Virginia past Syracuse 68-61

video.headline: Virginia remains unbeaten in conference play

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCB Highlight (Virginia remains unbeaten in conference play) 2018/01/09 ESHEET

headlines.description: Isaac Haas made a tiebreaking free throw with four seconds remaining and No. 5 Purdue remained unbeaten in the Big Ten with a 70-69 victory over Michigan on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Haas' free throw gives No. 5 Purdue 70-69 win over Michigan

video.headline: Matthews just misses potential game winner

headlines.description: Trae Young scored 22 of his 27 points in the second half to help No. 9 Oklahoma beat No. 8 Texas Tech 75-65 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Young's 27 lift No. 9 Oklahoma over No. 8 Texas Tech 75-65

video.headline: Young leads Oklahoma past Texas Tech

headlines.description: Malik Newman scored a career-high 27 points, Svi Mykhailiuk added 23 and No. 12 Kansas staved off an upset bid by Iowa State, pulling away in the closing minutes for an 83-78 victory Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Newman's career night helps No. 12 Kansas beat Iowa St 83-78

video.headline: Kansas' Newman gets block, clutch layup

headlines.description: For all the attention Marquette receives for its 3-point shooting, coach Steve Wojciechowski would rather have his team attack the rim.
headlines.shortLinkText: Marquette takes down No. 13 Seton Hall 84-64

video.headline: Marquette dominates Seton Hall in blowout

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCB Highlight (Marquette dominates Seton Hall in blowout) 2018/01/10 ESHEET

headlines.description: Luke Maye had career highs of 32 points and 18 rebounds while No. 20 North Carolina's small lineup got off to a fast start in a 96-66 win against Boston College on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Maye's huge night helps No. 20 UNC top Boston College 96-66

headlines.description: PJ Washington made a steal that led to Kevin Knox's go-ahead layup with 2:28 left, then added four points down the stretch to help No. 21 Kentucky rally past Texas A&M 74-73 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: No. 21 Kentucky rallies late, holds off Texas A&M 74-73

video.headline: Kentucky edges Texas A&M by a point

headlines.description: Desean Murray had 16 points and eight rebounds to help No. 22 Auburn erase a ten-point halftime deficit and beat Mississippi 85-70 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Murray rallies No. 22 Auburn over Ole Miss 85-70

headlines.description: Grant Williams scored a career-best 37 points as No. 24 Tennessee rallied from a 10-point deficit in the second half to beat Vanderbilt 92-84 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: No. 24 Tennessee rallies from 10 down, beats Vandy 92-84

video.headline: Williams' elevates for basket and new career high

headlines.description: Marcus Foster scored 21 of his 23 points in the first half, Martin Krampelj had 14 points and 14 rebounds for his third straight double-double and No. 25 Creighton beat Butler 85-74 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Foster scores 23 in No. 25 Creighton's 85-74 win over Butler

headlines.description: Juwan Morgan scored 21 points and Josh Newkirk added 16 on Tuesday to help Indiana hold off pesky Penn State 74-70.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hoosiers hold off pesky Penn St. 74-70 in defensive grinder

headlines.description: Patrick Ewing returned to Madison Square Garden and got the better of Chris Mullin and St. John's one more time in a throwback to their Big East days of the 1980s.
headlines.shortLinkText: Georgetown's Ewing tops St. John's Mullin 1 more time at MSG

video.headline: Ewing, Georgetown top Mullin, St. John's

headlines.description: John Petty scored 12 of his 15 points in the first half and Alabama beat South Carolina 76-62 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Alabama jumps out early to beat South Carolina 76-62

headlines.description: Jeremiah Martin made all 15 of his free throws and scored a career-high 31 points and Memphis turned back Tulane 96-89 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Martin 15-15 from the line, Memphis drops Tulane 96-89

headlines.description: Josh Cunningham scored 20 points on an almost perfect night shooting as Dayton picked up its first road win of the season, knocking off Richmond 87-81 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Cunningham has 20 points as Dayton holds off Richmond 87-81

headlines.description: Jared Terrell tossed in 20 points and Andre Berry added a double-double to propel Rhode Island to a 72-65 victory over Saint Louis on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Terrell, Berry spark Rhode Island past Saint Louis 72-65

headlines.description: Jeremy Harris and Nick Perkins scored 17 points apiece and C.J. Massinburg had a double-double to lead Buffalo to an 87-65 win over Akron on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Harris, Perkins net 17 each, lead Buffalo past Akron 87-65

headlines.description: Demajeo Wiggins converted a three-point play and Justin Turner hit two free throws in the final minute to secure Bowling Green's 66-57 win over Northern Illinois Tuesday night
headlines.shortLinkText: Bowling Green holds off Northern Illinois rally, 66-57

headlines.description: Trey Moses and Tayler Persons each scored 16 points and Ball State used a big second-half run to take the lead and post a 75-68 win over Ohio in a Mid-America Conference battle Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Moses, Persons fuel Ball State comeback over Ohio, 75-68

headlines.description: Elijah Minnie scored 14 of his 25 points in the final minutes and James Thompson IV added 17 points with 12 rebounds as Eastern Michigan held off Central Michigan 79-74 for its first Mid-American Conference win on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Minnie has hot finish to lead Eastern Mich. to 79-74 win

headlines.description: Tre'Shaun Fletcher had 21 points and Toledo rolled to an 84-61 victory over Western Michigan on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Toledo jumps out early, beats Western Michigan 84-61

headlines.description: Darrian Ringo scored 16 points, including 12 in the first half when Miami (Ohio) built a big lead, and added seven assists to guide the RedHawks to an 80-69 victory over Kent State on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Ringo leads Miami (OH) to 80-69 win over Kent St

headlines.description: Chris Clemons and Andrew Eudy combined to score 50 points to help power Campbell to its second straight Big South Conference victory, an 83-79 win at Presbyterian on Tuesday night to get to .500.
headlines.shortLinkText: Clemons, Eudy get Campbell to .500, beat Presbyterian 83-79

headlines.description: David Efianayi scored 23 points and Gardner-Webb cruised to a 62-45 victory over High Point on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Efianayi scores 23; Gardner-Webb beats High Point 62-54

headlines.description: Isaiah Williams was fouled as he hauled in an offensive rebound and then made two free throws in the final ten seconds as Liberty rallied to beat Winthrop 73-70 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Williams hits 2 late FTs to give Liberty 73-70 win

headlines.description: MaCio Teague scored 24 points and Ahmad Thomas reached a rare Big South Conference milestone to help UNC Asheville defeat Longwood 90-80 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Teague, Thomas shine as Asheville holds off Longwood 90-80

headlines.description: Carlik Jones had 15 points and three assists, two steals and a blocked shot to help Radford hold off Charleston Southern 64-61 on Tuesday night for its sixth straight victory.
headlines.shortLinkText: Radford beats Charleston Southern 64-61 for 6th straight win

headlines.description: Donte Thomas scored 22 points and grabbed seven rebounds as Bradley extended the Missouri Valley Conference's longest home winning streak by holding off Southern Illinois 68-62 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Bradley now 8-0 at home, tops Southern Illinois, 68-62

headlines.description: Jonathan Williams scored 21 points, Justin Tillman had 10 points and a season-high 17 rebounds, and VCU beat Duquesne 78-67 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: VCU wins 15th straight A-10 home game, beats Duquesne 78-67

headlines.description: Rodrick Sikes and Jordan Andrews had 16 points apiece as South Alabama thumped National Christian College Athletic Association's Trinity Baptist 99-34 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: South Alabama romps past Trinity Baptist 99-34

headlines.description: James Palmer Jr. had 18 points and Nebraska opened up a double-digit lead early in the second half then held off three Wisconsin surges to take a 63-59 win Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Palmer Jr. helps Nebraska hold off Wisconsin 63-59

headlines.description: Chandler Hutchison had 21 points, 10 rebounds and four assists for his eighth double-double of the season, Alex Hobbs scored 15 of his 20 points in the first half and Boise State beat Fresno State 70-64 on Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Hutchison scores 21, Boise State beats Fresno State 70-64

headlines.description: Malik Pope and Max Montana scored 17 points apiece for San Diego State, which used a 26-4 run spanning halftime to rout San Jose State 85-49 Tuesday night.
headlines.shortLinkText: Pope, Montana lead SDSU's 85-49 rout of Spartans

nowFeed.headline: USC junior forward Bennie Boatwright will miss the rest of the season after suffering a left patella injury during Thursday's win, per the school. Was averaging 13.6 points and 6.4 rebounds.
nowFeed.story: USC junior forward Bennie Boatwright will miss the rest of the season after suffering a left patella injury during Thursday's win, per the school. Was averaging 13.6 points and 6.4 rebounds.

nowFeed.headline: Back at @KUHoops Brings back a great memory thanks to a great group of players. @LBSUhoops https://t.co/aMhklA2Vbl
nowFeed.story: Back at @KUHoops Brings back a great memory thanks to a great group of players. @LBSUhoops vimeo.com/256137612

nowFeed.headline: Under Sean Miller Deandre Ayton is maximizing his enormous potential. Ayton has always possessed the physical tools and a solid basketball IQ. He has worked hard at Zona along with making the adjustments to college basketball. For a freshman big man it's really hard to dominate right away. Since he arrived in the states he was a top ranked player in his class. Would have been top 5 in last years NBA draft. Now he will be a top 3 pick and will be much more prepared.
nowFeed.story: Under Sean Miller Deandre Ayton is maximizing his enormous potential. Ayton has always possessed the physical tools and a solid basketball IQ. He has worked hard at Zona along with making the adjustments to college basketball. For a freshman big man it's really hard to dominate right away. Since he arrived in the states he was a top ranked player in his class. Would have been top 5 in last years NBA draft. Now he will be a top 3 pick and will be much more prepared.

nowFeed.headline:
The race for the No. 1 seeds is more wide open now after a few recent upsets. Per BPI, here's where we stand:

Virginia 99%
Villanova 98%
Purdue 71%
Michigan State 52%
Xavier 32%
Duke 29%
North Carolina 9%
Tennessee 4%
Auburn 3%
Kansas 2%

nowFeed.headline: Houston coach Kelvin Sampson said "good teams should win at home," including his Cougars, who are 13-0 this season at home, including Thursday's 67-62 upset of No. 5 Cincinnati.

nowFeed.headline: After losing 6 of the last 8 games, a surprise phone call from Big O was timely and uplifting for Trae Young. https://t.co/BKgoupMsR9

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati shot just 6-for-19 (31.6%) in the second half vs. Houston, including a FG drought of nearly 12 minutes down the stretch. The Bearcats got out rebounded 36-27. Both of those bit them tonight.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati shot just 6-for-19 (31.6%) in the second half vs. Houston, including a FG drought of nearly 12 minutes down the stretch. The Bearcats got out rebounded 36-27. Both of those bit them tonight.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati's loss at Houston will likely drop them from the No. 2-seed line in Joe Lunardi's Bracketology, with Texas Tech likely being the beneficiary to move up. The Cougars, who were a 10-seed coming into the night, scored another big resume win after picking one up over Wichita State in January.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati's loss at Houston will likely drop them from the No. 2-seed line in Joe Lunardi's Bracketology, with Texas Tech likely being the beneficiary to move up. The Cougars, who were a 10-seed coming into the night, scored another big resume win after picking one up over Wichita State in January.

nowFeed.headline: Houston upsets No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62, ending the Bearcats nation-leading 16-game winning streak. It's the first time the Cougars have beaten two top-10 opponents in a season since 1984.
nowFeed.story: Houston upsets No. 5 Cincinnati 67-62, ending the Bearcats nation-leading 16-game winning streak. It's the first time the Cougars have beaten two top-10 opponents in a season since 1984.

nowFeed.headline: Ironically, Cincinnati's loss to Houston also finally gives Cincinnati its first win over a likely NCAA Tournament team.
nowFeed.story: Ironically, Cincinnati's loss to Houston also finally gives Cincinnati its first win over a likely NCAA Tournament team.

nowFeed.headline: Cincinnati getting it done at the foul line tonight, hitting 17-of-21 free throw attempts. The Bearcats are hanging on to a 50-49 lead over Houston with 4:10 left.
nowFeed.story: Cincinnati getting it done at the foul line tonight, hitting 17-of-21 free throw attempts. The Bearcats are hanging on to a 50-49 lead over Houston with 4:10 left.
